attributes.action: scrap plans in the Digital Economy Bill that would allow the secretary of state to censor and block any website he see fits with no democratic process.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Clause 11 of the Digital Economy Bill will allow for:

"Obligations to limit internet access

The Secretary of State may at any time by order impose a technical obligation on internet service providers if the Secretary of State considers it appropriate in view of—
(a)
an assessment carried out or steps taken by OFCOM under
section 124G; or
(b)
any other consideration."

Quite apart from the fact that they are even considering Internet Censorship, undermining one of its fundamental principles, this could be done behind closed doors with absolutely no democratic say from the people, and no obligation to even announce what has been done.
